intro: Aster erectus, commonly known as the upright aster, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Native to regions of Europe and Asia, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Aster erectus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can also serve as a nectar source for pollinators.
